responses: Well met, traveler! Welcome to the Drunken Dragon Inn.
Ah, a new face! Pull up a chair and rest your weary feet.
Greetings, adventurer. What brings you to my humble tavern?

patterns: What do you have to drink?
responses: We've got the finest dwarven ale, elven wine, and a mysterious brew I wouldn't recommend after midnight.
A pint of dwarven stout or a glass of elven mead, the choice is yours!
For the brave, I've got a flaming dragon whiskey — care to try?
We've roasted boar, stew thick enough to stand a spoon in, and bread fresh from the ovens.
You'll find no finer mutton stew this side of the mountains.
Hungry, eh? A platter of cheese and bread will keep you strong for your travels.
They say a dragon was spotted near the old ruins to the north... though I don't fancy seeing it myself.
Rumor has it the king's treasury has gone missing — and the thieves are hiding in plain sight.
Some say the forest spirits are restless again. Might be trouble for travelers.
Safe travels, adventurer. May fortune favor you.
Until next time, traveler. The fire will be waiting for your return.
Go with the gods, and may your mug never run dry.
